_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
January 7th, 1:55 PM
Good afternoon riders and skiers! It's a powder day! 3-4 inches of dense snow fell overnight, and the snow globe is still shaking and groovin'! The forecast calls for cloudy skies with comfortable temps in the upper 20's at the summit and upper 20's to low 30's at the base by the afternoon.  Come enjoy powder and packed powder conditions earlier in the day, along with variable conditions found on natural terrain as new snow tops frozen surfaces. Snowmaking is on pause today until temps become more conducive.

We will be getting down on 440 skiable acres served by 11 lifts and 106 open trails, with 42 of those getting a fresh corduroy overnight. Check out fan favorite Jester to Spring Fling for a top-tier corduroy experience! Castlerock lift will be spinning today from 9:00 AM - 3:45 PM. North Lynx is scheduled to run starting tomorrow (Thursday) 9:00 AM -3:45 PM as well! All natural terrain is suggested for experts only as base coverage is thin and conditions are variable. Inverness will be closed today for racing events.

Operations have moved back to weekday hours, which means GMX kicks things off, loading at 8:00 AM. Followed by all other scheduled lifts at 9:00 AM. This weekend, look forward to Ikon early ups on Super Bravo loading at 7:30 AM- for Ikon pass holders looking to score some fresh cord and untouched powder before lifts open to the public.  Sugarbush offers a wide range of freestyle parks, whether youre just starting out or training for competitions, weve got you covered. At Mt. Ellen, Riemergasse offers 80 of the finest features on the East Coast, while Lincoln Peak is home to two mini parks featuring 12 creative elements. Sugar Run made its season debut today with 27 features including 3 jumps, bringing out total feature count to 119!

Sharpen Your Swing This Winter! Join PGA Pro Roger King Jan 12th from 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM at the SIM Suites in the SHaRC for exclusive winter golf lessons. Using state-of-the-art simulators, you'll get personalized tips and real-time feedback to improve your swing, accuracy, and overall game. Check out all of our winter events!

All uphill routes are open at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen, check out our uphill travel policy for more info. *Lincoln Peak evening route will stop at the top of Gate House, due to operations on North Lynx terrain*
